sub_topic: Calculating the surface area of a cylinder.
message_1: What is the surface area of a cylinder with a radius of 5 cm and a height of 10 cm?
message_2:
The surface area of a cylinder can be calculated using the formula:

Surface Area = 2πr(h + r)

where r is the radius and h is the height of the cylinder.

Given a radius (r) of 5 cm and a height (h) of 10 cm, we can plug these values into the formula:

Surface Area = 2π(5)(10 + 5)
Surface Area = 2π(5)(15)
Surface Area = 10π(15)
Surface Area = 150π

The surface area of the cylinder is 150π square centimeters. If you want a numerical approximation, you can use the value of π ≈ 3.14159:

Surface Area ≈ 150 * 3.14159 ≈ 471.2385 square centimeters.
